question:
How to preserve whole grapes.

Choices:
A: Wash grapes well in cool water, pat dry with a towel, spread into even layer on baking sheet and place in freezer until frozen, then place in freezer bags for up to 6 months.
B: Wash grapes well in cool water, pat dry with a towel, spread into even layer on baking sheet and place in the oven until frozen, then place in freezer bags for up to 6 months.
steps: Preserving grapes involves cleaning them first to ensure no dirt or pesticides remain.
Drying the grapes with a towel helps prevent ice formation on the grapes, which can affect their texture.
Spreading the grapes in an even layer on a baking sheet helps to freeze them uniformly, preventing them from sticking together.
A freezer is used to freeze the grapes because it provides the necessary low temperature required to preserve them. Ovens do not have the capability to freeze items; they are used for heating.
Finally, placing the frozen grapes in freezer bags helps protect them from freezer burn and makes storage easier for up to 6 months.
